page.title: 15 STONEBRIDGE POND,FAVERSHAM
page.content: The West Brook flows from the {Chart Gunpowder Mills} into {Stonebridge Pond.}When the gunpowder industry closed down in Faversham,the Pond was preserved as an amenity for local people and a popular attraction for visitors.It is a beautiful scene with trees and bushes reflected in the water.{Davington Church} lies on the hill overlooking the Pond which is a home for wild birds.There is a pair of swans,some coots and many mallards,all with young.People come with bread to feed the ducks.There are not so many ducks this year,due to injuries and a severely cold winter. Local residents have been keeping a close watch on the pond to ensure the safety of the birds so that the pond will continue to be an attractive and interesting place to visit.
